com.github.katjahahn.parser.sections

Class SectionLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.parser.sections.SectionLoader

  • public class SectionLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for computing section related values that are necessary for loading a section---for example conversion between relative virtual addresses and file offset---, loading data directories, and loading sections.

    The section loader is able to load special sections like the ImportSection, ExportSection and ResourceSection

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SectionLoader.LoadInfo
      Data object.

    • Method Detail

      • maybeLoadSection

        @Beta
public com.google.common.base.Optional<PESection> maybeLoadSection(java.lang.String name)
                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the first section with the given name (given the order of the section headers). If the file doesn't have a section by this name, it returns absent.

        This does not instantiate special sections. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead.

        The file on disk is read to fetch the information.

        Parameters:
        name - the section's name
        Returns:
        PESection of the given name, absent if section isn't contained in file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file

      • loadSection

        public PESection loadSection(int sectionNr)
        Loads the section that has the sectionNr.

        This does not instantiate special sections. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead.

        Parameters:
        sectionNr - the section's number
        Returns:
        PESection instance of the given number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid sectionNr

      • loadSectionFrom

        public PESection loadSectionFrom(SectionHeader header)
        Loads the section that belongs to the header.

        This does not instantiate special sections. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead.

        Parameters:
        header - the section's header
        Returns:
        PESection that belongs to the header

      • getReadSize

        public long getReadSize(SectionHeader header)
        Determines the number of bytes that is read for the section.

        This is the actual section size.

        Parameters:
        header - header of the section
        Returns:
        section size
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if header is null

      • getActualVirtSize

        public long getActualVirtSize(SectionHeader header)

      • maybeGetSectionHeader

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<SectionHeader> maybeGetSectionHeader(DataDirectoryKey dataDirKey)
        Fetches the SectionHeader of the section the data directory entry for the dataDirKey points into.

        Returns absent if the data directory doesn't exist.

        Parameters:
        dataDirKey - the data directory key
        Returns:
        the section table entry the data directory entry of that key points into or absent if there is no data dir entry for the key available

      • maybeGetFileOffsetFor

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.Long> maybeGetFileOffsetFor(DataDirectoryKey dataDirKey)
        Returns the file offset of the data directory entry the given key belongs to.

        Returns absent if data directory doesn't exist.

        Parameters:
        dataDirKey - the key of the data directory entry
        Returns:
        file offset of the rva that is in the data directory entry with the given key, absent if file offset can not be determined

      • getFileOffset

        public long getFileOffset(long rva)
        Returns the file offset for the given RVA.

        A warning is issued if the file offset is outside the file, but the file offset will be returned nevertheless.

        Parameters:
        rva - the relative virtual address that shall be converted to a plain file offset
        Returns:
        file offset

      • maybeGetFileOffset

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.Long> maybeGetFileOffset(long rva)
        Returns the file offset for the given RVA. Returns absent if file offset is not within file.
        Parameters:
        rva - the relative virtual address that shall be converted to a plain file offset
        Returns:
        file offset

      • maybeGetSectionHeaderByRVA

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<SectionHeader> maybeGetSectionHeaderByRVA(long rva)
        Returns the section entry of the section table the rva is pointing into.
        Parameters:
        rva - the relative virtual address
        Returns:
        the SectionHeader of the section the rva is pointing into

      • maybeGetSectionHeaderByOffset

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<SectionHeader> maybeGetSectionHeaderByOffset(long fileOffset)
        Returns the section entry of the section table the offset is pointing into.
        Parameters:
        fileOffset - the file offset
        Returns:
        the SectionHeader of the section the offset is pointing into

      • maybeLoadSpecialSection

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<? extends SpecialSection> maybeLoadSpecialSection(DataDirectoryKey key)
        To get rid of code repetition in the maybeLoadXSection() methods, this abtracts the behaviour of assembling the LoadInfo and calling the factory methods of the special sections based on the data directory key.

        This results in having to cast the return value to the appropriate type, but correct types are well tested with unit tests.

        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        the special section optional that belongs to the key. Absent if no special section for that key available or an error occurs.

      • loadBoundImportSection

        public BoundImportSection loadBoundImportSection()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Loads all bytes and information of the bound import section. The file on disk is read to fetch the information.
        Returns:
        ImportSection of the given file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if unable to load debug section

      • hasValidPointer

        @Beta
public boolean hasValidPointer(DataDirectoryKey dataDirKey)
        Returns whether the virtual address of the data directory entry is valid. TODO remove
        Parameters:
        dataDirKey -
        Returns:
        true iff virtual address is valid

      • isValidSection

        @Beta
public boolean isValidSection(SectionHeader header)
        Returns whether the section is valid.

        A section is valid if the readsize is greater than 0 and the section start is within the file.

        Parameters:
        header - the section's header
        Returns:
        true iff section is valid
        See Also:
        getReadSize(SectionHeader)

      • containsEntryPoint

        @Beta
public boolean containsEntryPoint(SectionHeader header)
        Returns whether the section contains the entry point of the file.
        Parameters:
        header - the header of the section that may contain the entry point.
        Returns:
        true if entry point is within the section, false otherwise
